@phatpigeon,
 you did not boot from it, you just placed the CD in the optical unit and started your old (existing) Xp !

Enter BIOS, select the first booting device CD-DVD unit, exit bios saving the config. and when it says: "Press any key ..." do listen to it.

@Reneage, 
If there is a real freeze and not something else...there are many things that could generate it:
- dry thermal paste between a vital component and it's cooling device (GPU, CPU, N-Bridge, S-Bridge)
- unsupported overclocking
- bad BIOS config
- bad hardware jumper insertion
- unproper connection or function of a device (RAM, floppy, HDD)
- infected boot
- laptop PC that has a specific hardware ID made by the bitchy producer...that supports some special versions of XP...specially made for those rare laptops
- bad HDD formatting 
so on
try to observe it more, report something more specific so that we could focus on the issue

Nice! I had little to do, most of my normal changes were already done.

Ok for all those people who want to boot it via usb,so that use can install it in a netbook

*first dowload wintoflash (it is a software that allows to flash your os on a usb flash drive)
*download Daemon tools or anything similar like (alcohol etc)
*mount your microsoft xp sp3 image using the tool
*now again goto wintoflash and select the advanced tab and there you have options to select the os then press next
*set the windows source path as the mounted cd drive(in my case it is F:)
*set the usb drive as your flash drive eg E:/

press next,next and then it will format your usb and write the data into it

There it is you have a bootable winxp flashdrive
